# Resources

Here you will find a curated list of resources related to the development, implementation and scaling of the principles and practices outlined in this Equity Data Handbook.

## 2026 Road Show Presentations

Equity Data Handbook Leads will be presenting to various Water Boards groups in 2026 to:

-   Provide updates on Equity Data Handbook Development
-   Provide a demonstration / overview of each chapter in the Handbook
-   Review opportunities for support in 2026, including:
    -   2026 Openscapes Champions process
    -   Environmental Justice RT Racial Equity Data Subcommittee
-   Questions & Discussion

Contact Anna Holder via email or MS Teams Chat if you'd like us to present to your Water Boards Region, Division, Office, Branch, Section, Roundtable or other group meeting!

Presentations currently scheduled include:

-   Jan 13: Water Quality Certs (401) Roundtable
-   Jan 22: Forestry and Wildfire Resiliency Roundtable
-   Feb 4: USTs Roundtable – Regional Boards Mtg
-   Feb 10: Power BItes Lunch & Learn
-   Feb 11:
    -   USTs Roundtable – Local Oversight Program Mtg
    -   Division of Water Quality All-Staff
-   Feb 19: Integrated Report Roundtable
-   Mar 10: Surface Water Ambient Monitoring Program (SWAMP) Roundtable
-   Mar 12:
    -   Cannabis Cultivation Program Roundtable
    -   Waste Discharge Requirements Program Roundtable
-   Apr 21: Site Cleanup / DoD Roundtable
-   May 13: GIS & Data Science Roundtable

## Toolkits

-   [A Toolkit for Centering Racial Equity Throughout Data Integration](https://aisp.upenn.edu/resource-article/a-toolkit-for-centering-racial-equity-throughout-data-integration/)
-   [Beyond Compliance Network Advocacy Toolkit](https://beyondcompliance.pubpub.org/pub/c90gqevm/release/2)
-   [The Water Boards Office of Research Planning and Performance Water Conservation and Urban Water folks tool](%3Chttps://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/conservation_portal/water-use-explorer/)
-   [Water Boards Division of Drinking Water SAFER Outreach Tool](https://gispublic.waterboards.ca.gov/portal/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=70d27423735e45d6b037b7fbaea9a6a6)
-   Many local city and county governments have compiled their own resources for working with equity data (Examples below). Before starting your project, it is a good idea to do some research online to identify pre-existing resources available in your region.
    -   Oakland's [Geographic Equity Toolbox](https://www.oaklandca.gov/resources/oakdot-geographic-equity-toolbox)
    -   Portland's [Racial Equity Toolkit](https://www.portlandoregon.gov/oehr/71685)
    -   New York City's interactive equity data tool [EquityNYC](https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fequity.nyc.gov%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cnicholas.martorano%40waterboards.ca.gov%7C87a614b2e3db4c85368c08dbc55a8595%7Cfe186a257d4941e6994105d2281d36c1%7C0%7C0%7C638320764855634179%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=r%2Br4%2BybTh130ovhG12PjYHQYqVHlz4jSB8gXj3KTnAI%3D&reserved=0), including a [Mapping Equity tool](https://equity.nyc.gov/mapping-equity).
